Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black with two added white bands; exterior reserved save for ivy leaf band at lip and single vertical stroke in field below.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Chalices that lack filling ornament first appear in the Grand Style, starting in circa 580BC.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 335, no. 1652, pl. 219)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 81, no. 3, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0868) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
